pli-tv-kd17:1.4.1.pli: Atha kho bhaddiyo ca sakyarājā anuruddho ca ānando ca bhagu ca kimilo ca devadatto ca, upālikappakena sattamā, yathā pure caturaṅginiyā senāya uyyānabhūmiṁ niyyanti, evameva caturaṅginiyā senāya niyyiṁsu.
pli-tv-kd17:1.4.1.en: Soon afterwards King Bhaddiya, Anuruddha, Ānanda, Bhagu, Kimila, and Devadatta, with the barber Upāli as the seventh, went out to the park with the fourfold army, just as they used to.

pli-tv-kd17:1.4.34.en: whereas Devadatta obtained supernormal powers, but no stage of awakening.

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.4.pli: Atha kho devadattassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.4.en: At this time, while in seclusion, Devadatta thought,

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.10.pli: Atha kho devadatto senāsanaṁ saṁsāmetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena rājagahaṁ tena pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.10.en: Devadatta put his dwelling in order, took his bowl and robes, and left for Rājagaha,

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.14.pli: Atha kho devadatto ajātasattuṁ kumāraṁ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.19.pli: “Sace kho tvaṁ, bhante, ayyo devadatto, iṅgha sakeneva vaṇṇena pātubhavassū”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.19.en: “If you are Venerable Devadatta, then please appear in your own form.”

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.20.pli: Atha kho devadatto kumārakavaṇṇaṁ paṭisaṁharitvā saṅghāṭipattacīvaradharo ajātasattussa kumārassa purato aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.20.en: Devadatta abandoned the form of a boy and then stood in front of Ajātasattu, wearing his robes and carrying his bowl.

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.21.pli: Atha kho ajātasattu kumāro devadattassa iminā iddhipāṭihāriyena abhippasanno pañcahi rathasatehi sāyaṁ pātaṁ upaṭṭhānaṁ gacchati, pañca ca thālipākasatāni bhattābhihāro abhiharīyati.
pli-tv-kd17:2.1.21.en: By means of this wonder Devadatta was able to inspire Ajātasattu to have confidence in him. Ajātasattu then attended on him morning and evening, with five hundred carriages and a meal offering of five hundred dishes of food.

pli-tv-kd17:2.1.23.en: Devadatta started desiring to lead the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-kd17:2.2.7.pli: “devadattassa, bhante, lābhasakkārasilokena abhibhūtassa pariyādinnacittassa evarūpaṁ icchāgataṁ uppajji—

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.6.pli: “devadattassa, bhante, ajātasattu kumāro pañcahi rathasatehi sāyaṁ pātaṁ upaṭṭhānaṁ gacchati;
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.6.en: “Venerable Sir, Prince Ajātasattu attends on Devadatta morning and evening, with five hundred carriages

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.8.en: “Don’t envy Devadatta, monks, his gain, honor, and fame.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.9.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, devadattassa ajātasattu kumāro pañcahi rathasatehi sāyaṁ pātaṁ upaṭṭhānaṁ gamissati, pañca ca thālipākasatāni bhattābhihāro abhiharīyissati, hāniyeva, bhikkhave, devadattassa pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu, no vuḍḍhi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.9.en: So long as Prince Ajātasattu treats him like this, Devadatta can be expected to decline in good qualities.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.11.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, yāvakīvañca devadattassa ajātasattu kumāro pañcahi rathasatehi sāyaṁ pātaṁ upaṭṭhānaṁ gamissati, pañca ca thālipākasatāni bhattābhihāro abhiharīyissati, hāniyeva, bhikkhave, devadattassa pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu, no vuḍḍhi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.11.en: so too, so long as Prince Ajātasattu treats like this, Devadatta can be expected to decline in good qualities.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.12.pli: Attavadhāya, bhikkhave, devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.12.en: Devadatta’s gain, honor, and fame will cause his destruction and ruin.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.14.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, attavadhāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.14.en: so too do Devadatta’s gain, honor, and fame cause his own destruction and ruin.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.16.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, attavadhāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.16.en: so too do Devadatta’s gain, honor, and fame cause his own destruction and ruin.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.18.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, attavadhāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi.
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.18.en: so too do Devadatta’s gain, honor, and fame cause his own destruction and ruin.

pli-tv-kd17:2.5.20.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, attavadhāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādīti.
pli-tv-kd17:2.5.20.en: so too do Devadatta’s gain, honor, and fame cause his own destruction and ruin.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.2.pli: Atha kho devadatto uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā yena bhagavā tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.1.2.en: Then Devadatta got up from his seat, put his upper robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms, and said,

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.6.pli: “Alaṁ, devadatta, mā te rucci bhikkhusaṅghaṁ pariharitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.1.6.en: “Let it be, Devadatta, don’t think of leading the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.7.en: A second time Devadatta said the same thing and got the same reply.

pli-tv-kd17:3.1.16.pli: Ayañcarahi devadattassa bhagavati paṭhamo āghāto ahosi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.1.16.en: This was the first time Devadatta had ill will toward the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.2.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho devadattassa rājagahe pakāsanīyaṁ kammaṁ karotu—
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.2.en: “Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure to announce the following about Devadatta in Rājagaha:

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.3.pli: ‘pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.3.en: ‘Previously Devadatta had one nature, now he has another.

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.4.pli: Yaṁ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo’ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.4.en: Whatever Devadatta does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta.’

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.8.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ saṅgho devadattassa rājagahe pakāsanīyaṁ kammaṁ kareyya—
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.8.en: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure to announce the following about Devadatta in Rājagaha:

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.9.pli: “pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.9.en: ‘Previously Devadatta had one nature, now he has another.

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.10.pli: Yaṁ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.10.en: Whatever Devadatta does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta.’

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.13.pli: Saṅgho devadattassa rājagahe pakāsanīyaṁ kammaṁ karoti—
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.13.en: The Sangha does a legal procedure to announce the following about Devadatta in Rājagaha:

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.14.pli: “pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.14.en: ‘Previously Devadatta had one nature, now he has another.

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.15.pli: Yaṁ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.15.en: Whatever Devadatta does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta.’

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.20.pli: Kataṁ saṅghena devadattassa rājagahe pakāsanīyaṁ kammaṁ—
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.20.en: The Sangha has done a legal procedure to announce the following about Devadatta in Rājagaha:

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.21.pli: “pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.21.en: ‘Previously Devadatta had one nature, now he has another.

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.22.pli: Yaṁ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.22.en: Whatever Devadatta does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta.’

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.25.pli: “tena hi tvaṁ, sāriputta, devadattaṁ rājagahe pakāsehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.25.en: “Well then, Sāriputta, make the announcement about Devadatta in Rājagaha.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.26.pli: “Pubbe mayā, bhante, devadattassa rājagahe vaṇṇo bhāsito—
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.26.en: “Previously, Venerable Sir, I have praised Devadatta in Rājagaha,

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.28.en: How then can I now make this announcement about Devadatta in Rājagaha?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.29.pli: “Nanu tayā, sāriputta, bhūtoyeva devadattassa rājagahe vaṇṇo bhāsito—
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.29.en: “Didn’t you truthfully praise Devadatta in Rājagaha

pli-tv-kd17:3.2.32.pli: “Evameva kho tvaṁ, sāriputta, bhūtaṁyeva devadattaṁ rājagahe pakāsehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.2.32.en: “In the same way, you should truthfully make an announcement about Devadatta in Rājagaha.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.2.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho sāriputtaṁ sammannatu devadattaṁ rājagahe pakāsetuṁ—
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.2.en: “Well then, the Sangha should appoint Sāriputta to make that announcement about Devadatta in Rājagaha.

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.9.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ sammanneyya devadattaṁ rājagahe pakāsetuṁ—
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.9.en: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should appoint Venerable Sāriputta to make the following announcement about Devadatta in Rājagaha:

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.10.pli: “pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.10.en: ‘Previously Devadatta had one nature, now he has another.

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.11.pli: Yaṁ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.11.en: Whatever Devadatta does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta.’

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.14.pli: Saṅgho āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ sammannati devadattaṁ rājagahe pakāsetuṁ—
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.14.en: The Sangha appoints Venerable Sāriputta to make the following announcement about Devadatta in Rājagaha:

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.15.pli: “pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati, yaṁ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.15.en: ‘Previously Devadatta had one nature, now he has another. Whatever Devadatta does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta.’

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.20.pli: Sammato saṅghena āyasmā sāriputto devadattaṁ rājagahe pakāsetuṁ—
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.20.en: The Sangha has appointed Venerable Sāriputta to make the following announcement about Devadatta in Rājagaha:

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.21.pli: “pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.21.en: ‘Previously Devadatta had one nature, now he has another.

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.22.pli: Yaṁ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.22.en: Whatever Devadatta does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta.’

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.24.pli: Sammato ca āyasmā sāriputto sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṁ rājagahaṁ pavisitvā devadattaṁ rājagahe pakāsesi—
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.24.en: When he had been appointed, Sāriputta entered Rājagaha accompanied by a number of monks. He then made that announcement about Devadatta:

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.25.pli: “pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.25.en: “Previously Devadatta had one nature, now he has another.

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.26.pli: Yaṁ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.26.en: Whatever Devadatta does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.28.pli: “usūyakā ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā devadattassa lābhasakkāraṁ usūyantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.28.en: “These Sakyan ascetics are envious of Devadatta’s gain and honor.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.3.30.pli: “na kho idaṁ orakaṁ bhavissati yathā bhagavā devadattaṁ rājagahe pakāsāpetī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.3.30.en: “This must be a serious matter, in that the Buddha has an announcement made about Devadatta in Rājagaha.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.1.pli: Atha kho devadatto yena ajātasattu kumāro tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā ajātasattuṁ kumāraṁ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.4.1.en: Soon afterwards Devadatta went to Prince Ajātasattu and said,

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.7.pli: “ayyo kho devadatto mahiddhiko mahānubhāvo, jāneyyāsi ayyo devadatto”ti—
pli-tv-kd17:3.4.7.en: “Venerable Devadatta is powerful and mighty. He would know.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.17.pli: “kumāro ca hantabbo, devadatto ca, sabbe ca bhikkhū hantabbā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.4.17.en: “The Prince should be executed, as well as Devadatta and all the monks.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.4.21.en: The Prince should be executed, as well as Devadatta.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.16.pli: ‘pubbe devadattassa aññā pakati ahosi, idāni aññā pakati.
pli-tv-kd17:3.5.16.en: ‘Previously Devadatta had one nature, now he has another.

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.17.pli: Yaṁ devadatto kareyya kāyena vācāya, na tena buddho vā dhammo vā saṅgho vā daṭṭhabbo, devadattova tena daṭṭhabbo’”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:3.5.17.en: Whatever Devadatta does by body or speech has nothing to do with the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha, but only with Devadatta’?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.25.en: to execute the Prince and Devadatta;

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.1.pli: Atha kho devadatto yena ajātasattu kumāro tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā ajātasattuṁ kumāraṁ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.6.1.en: Soon afterwards Devadatta went to Ajātasattu and said,

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.4.pli: “yathā, bhaṇe, ayyo devadatto āha tathā kareyyāthā”ti.

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.5.pli: Atha kho devadatto ekaṁ purisaṁ āṇāpesi—

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.1.pli: Atha kho so eko puriso yena devadatto tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā devadattaṁ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.9.1.en: Soon afterwards that one man went to Devadatta and said,

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.8.pli: Atha kho devadatto gijjhakūṭaṁ pabbataṁ āruhitvā mahatiṁ silaṁ pavijjhi—
pli-tv-kd17:3.9.8.en: Devadatta climbed the peak and threw down a large stone, thinking,

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.12.pli: Atha kho bhagavā uddhaṁ ulloketvā devadattaṁ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.9.12.en: The Buddha looked up and said to Devadatta,

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.15.pli: “idaṁ, bhikkhave, devadattena paṭhamaṁ ānantariyaṁ kammaṁ upacitaṁ, yaṁ duṭṭhacittena vadhakacittena tathāgatassa ruhiraṁ uppāditan”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.9.15.en: “With an evil mind intent on murder Devadatta has made the Buddha bleed. This is his first action with immediate results.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.2.en: that Devadatta was trying to murder the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.2.pli: Atha kho devadatto rājagahaṁ pavisitvā hatthisālaṁ gantvā hatthibhaṇḍe etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.11.2.en: Devadatta then entered Rājagaha, went to the elephant stables, and said to the elephant keepers,

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.2.pli: “yāva pāpo ayaṁ devadatto, alakkhiko, yatra hi nāma samaṇassa gotamassa evaṁmahiddhikassa evaṁmahānubhāvassa vadhāya parakkamissatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.2.en: “How evil he is this Devadatta, how benighted, in that he tries to kill the ascetic Gotama so powerful and mighty.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena devadatto parihīnalābhasakkāro sapariso kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjati.
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.5.1.en: Because of decline in material support and loss of respect, Devadatta and his followers were only invited to meals after repeatedly asking.

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma devadatto sapariso kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjissatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.11.en: “How can Devadatta and his followers eat at invitations after repeatedly asking?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.12.en: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.13.pli: “saccaṁ kira tvaṁ, devadatta, sapariso kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjasī”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.13.en: “Is it true, Devadatta, that you do this?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.14.1.pli: Atha kho devadatto yena kokāliko kaṭamodakatissako khaṇḍadeviyā putto samuddadatto tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā kokālikaṁ kaṭamodakatissakaṁ khaṇḍadeviyā puttaṁ samuddadattaṁ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd17:3.14.1.en: Soon afterwards Devadatta went to see Kokālika, Kaṭamodakatissaka, Khaṇḍadeviyā-putta, and Samuddadatta, and he said to them,

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.1.pli: Atha kho devadatto sapariso yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd17:3.15.1.en: Devadatta and his followers then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.2.pli: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho devadatto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.20.pli: Atha kho devadatto sapariso rājagahaṁ pavisitvā pañcahi vatthūhi janaṁ saññāpesi—
pli-tv-kd17:3.15.20.en: Devadatta then entered Rājagaha and won people over with the five points,

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.4.pli: Ye pana te manussā saddhā pasannā paṇḍitā byattā buddhimanto, te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd17:3.16.4.en: But the wise people who had faith and confidence complained and criticized Devadatta,

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma devadatto bhagavato saṅghabhedāya parakkamissati cakkabhedāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.16.5.en: “How can Devadatta pursue schism in the Sangha of the Buddha, a break in transmission?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.9.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ …pe…
pli-tv-kd17:3.16.9.en: They then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:

pli-tv-kd17:3.16.10.pli: “saccaṁ kira tvaṁ, devadatta, saṅghabhedāya parakkamasi cakkabhedāyā”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:3.16.10.en: He said, “Is it true, Devadatta, that you’re pursuing schism in the Sangha, a break in transmission?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.2.pli: Addasā kho devadatto āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ rājagahe piṇḍāya carantaṁ.

pli-tv-kd17:3.17.11.en: adding, “From today, Venerable Sir, Devadatta has created a schism in the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.1.pli: Atha kho devadatto tadahuposathe uṭṭhāyāsanā salākaṁ gāhesi—
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.1.en: On the observance day soon afterwards, Devadatta got up from his seat and distributed voting tickets, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.14.pli: Atha kho devadatto saṅghaṁ bhinditvā pañcamattāni bhikkhusatāni ādāya yena gayāsīsaṁ tena pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.14.en: Then, after causing a schism in the Sangha, Devadatta left for Gayāsīsa together with five hundred monks.

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.17.pli: “devadatto, bhante, saṅghaṁ bhinditvā pañcamattāni bhikkhusatāni ādāya yena gayāsīsaṁ tena pakkanto”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.17.en: “Venerable Sir, Devadatta has split the Sangha and left for Gayāsīsa together with five hundred monks.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.24.pli: “Yepi te, bhante, bhagavato aggasāvakā sāriputtamoggallānā tepi devadattassa santike gacchanti devadattassa dhammaṁ rocentā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.24.en: He replied, “Even Sāriputta and Moggallāna, the Buddha’s chief disciples, are going to Devadatta because they approve of his teaching.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.1.25.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhu, anavakāso, yaṁ sāriputtamoggallānā devadattassa dhammaṁ roceyyuṁ, api ca te gatā bhikkhūnaṁ saññattiyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.1.25.en: “It’s impossible for Sāriputta and Moggallāna to approve of Devadatta’s teaching. Instead, they’ve gone to win those monks over.”

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena devadatto mahatiyā parisāya parivuto dhammaṁ desento nisinno hoti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.2.1.en: On that occasion Devadatta was seated giving a teaching surrounded by a great gathering.

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.2.pli: Addasā kho devadatto sāriputtamoggallāne dūratova āgacchante.
pli-tv-kd17:4.2.2.en: When Devadatta saw Sāriputta and Moggallāna coming,

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.11.pli: Atha kho devadatto āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ upaḍḍhāsanena nimantesi—

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.15.pli: Atha kho devadatto bahudeva rattiṁ bhikkhū dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ ajjhesi—
pli-tv-kd17:4.2.15.en: After spending most of the night instructing, inspiring, and gladdening the monks with a teaching, Devadatta invited Sāriputta, saying

pli-tv-kd17:4.2.19.pli: Atha kho devadatto catugguṇaṁ saṅghāṭiṁ paññapetvā dakkhiṇena passena seyyaṁ kappesi.
pli-tv-kd17:4.2.19.en: Devadatta then folded his upper robe in four and lay down on his right side.

pli-tv-kd17:4.3.9.en: In the meantime Kokālika woke up Devadatta, saying,

pli-tv-kd17:4.3.10.pli: “uṭṭhehi, āvuso devadatta, nītā te bhikkhū sāriputtamoggallānehi.
pli-tv-kd17:4.3.10.en: “Get up, Devadatta, your monks are being led away by Sāriputta and Moggallāna.

pli-tv-kd17:4.3.14.pli: Atha kho devadattassa tattheva uṇhaṁ lohitaṁ mukhato uggañchi.
pli-tv-kd17:4.3.14.en: And right there warm blood emerged from Devadatta’s mouth.

pli-tv-kd17:4.4.7.pli: Kathaṁ pana te, sāriputta, devadatto paṭipajjī”ti?
pli-tv-kd17:4.4.7.en: And Devadatta, how did he treat you?”

pli-tv-kd17:4.5.11.pli: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, devadatto mamānukrubbaṁ kapaṇo marissatīti.
pli-tv-kd17:4.5.11.en: Just so, by imitating me, Devadatta will die miserably.

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.1.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
pli-tv-kd17:4.7.1.en: Because he is overcome by and immersed in eight bad qualities, Devadatta is irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.3.pli: Lābhena, bhikkhave, abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho;
pli-tv-kd17:4.7.3.en: Because Devadatta is overcome by and immersed in gain,

pli-tv-kd17:4.7.49.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
pli-tv-kd17:4.7.49.en: Because he is overcome by and immersed in three bad qualities, Devadatta is irredeemably destined to an eon in hell.

pli-tv-kd17:4.8.8.en: I have heard Devadatta was like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.2.pli: Atha kho devadatto yena kokāliko kaṭamodakatissako khaṇḍadeviyā putto samuddadatto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā kokālikaṁ kaṭamodakatissakaṁ khaṇḍadeviyā puttaṁ samuddadattaṁ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.2.en: At that time Devadatta went to see Kokālika, Kaṭamodakatissaka, Khaṇḍadeviyā-putta, and Samuddadatta, and he said to them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.1.pli: Atha kho devadatto sapariso yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.1.en: Devadatta and his followers then went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.2.pli: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho devadatto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.18.pli: Atha kho devadatto sapariso rājagahaṁ pavisitvā pañcahi vatthūhi janaṁ saññāpesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.18.en: Devadatta then entered Rājagaha and won people over with the five points,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.4.pli: Ye pana te manussā saddhā pasannā paṇḍitā byattā buddhimanto te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.4.en: But the wise people who had faith and confidence complained and criticized Devadatta,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma devadatto bhagavato saṅghabhedāya parakkamissati cakkabhedāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.5.en: “How can Devadatta pursue schism in the Sangha of the Buddha?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.9.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū devadattaṁ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.9.en: After rebuking Devadatta in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.10.pli: “saccaṁ kira tvaṁ, devadatta, saṅghabhedāya parakkamasi cakkabhedāyā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.10.en: “Is it true, Devadatta, that you are pursuing schism in the Sangha, a break in transmission?”

an8.7:1.1.pli: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate acirapakkante devadatte.
an8.7:1.1.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain, not long after Devadatta had left.

an8.7:1.2.pli: Tatra bhagavā devadattaṁ ārabbha bhikkhū āmantesi:
an8.7:1.2.en: There the Buddha spoke to the mendicants about Devadatta:

an8.7:1.7.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
an8.7:1.7.en: Overcome and overwhelmed by eight things that oppose the true teaching, Devadatta is going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.

an8.7:2.9.pli: pāpamittatāya, bhikkhave, abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
an8.7:2.9.en: bad friendship, Devadatta is going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.

an8.7:2.10.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
an8.7:2.10.en: Overcome and overwhelmed by these eight things that oppose the true teaching, Devadatta is going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.

7. Devadatta’s Failure

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena devadatto saṅghabhedāya parakkamati cakkabhedāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.2.en: At that time Devadatta was pursuing schism in the Sangha, a break in transmission.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.4.en: “Devadatta speaks contrary to the Teaching and the training.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.8.en: Devadatta does speak in accordance with the Teaching and the training.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū devadattassa saṅghabhedāya parakkamantassa anuvattakā bhavissanti vaggavādakā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.11.en: “How can these monks support Devadatta’s pursuit of schism in the Sangha?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.13.pli: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū devadattassa saṅghabhedāya parakkamantassa anuvattakā honti vaggavādakā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.13.en: “Is it true, monks, that some monks support Devadatta’s pursuit of schism in the Sangha?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.16.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā devadattassa saṅghabhedāya parakkamantassa anuvattakā bhavissanti vaggavādakā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.16.en: “… Monks, how can those foolish men support Devadatta’s pursuit of schism in the Sangha?

11. The training rule on supporting a schism

sn17.36:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena devadattassa ajātasattukumāro pañcahi rathasatehi sāyaṁ pātaṁ upaṭṭhānaṁ gacchati, pañca ca thālipākasatāni bhattābhihāro abhiharīyati.
sn17.36:1.2.en: Now at that time Prince Ajātasattu was going with five hundred carts in the morning and the evening to attend on Devadatta, presenting him with an offering of five hundred servings of food.

sn17.36:1.4.pli: “devadattassa, bhante, ajātasattukumāro pañcahi rathasatehi sāyaṁ pātaṁ upaṭṭhānaṁ gacchati, pañca ca thālipākasatāni bhattābhihāro abhiharīyatī”ti.
sn17.36:1.4.en: “Sir, Prince Ajātasattu is going with five hundred carts in the morning and the evening to attend on Devadatta, presenting him with an offering of five hundred servings of food.”

sn17.36:1.5.en: “Mendicants, don’t envy Devadatta’s possessions, honor, and popularity.

sn17.36:1.6.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, devadattassa ajātasattukumāro pañcahi rathasatehi sāyaṁ pātaṁ upaṭṭhānaṁ gamissati, pañca ca thālipākasatāni bhattābhihāro āharīyissati, hāniyeva, bhikkhave, devadattassa pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu, no vuddhi.
sn17.36:1.6.en: As long as Prince Ajātasattu goes with five hundred carts in the morning and the evening to attend on Devadatta, presenting him with an offering of five hundred servings of food, Devadatta can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities.

sn17.36:2.2.pli: evameva, bhikkhave, yāvakīvañca devadattassa ajātasattukumāro pañcahi rathasatehi sāyaṁ pātaṁ upaṭṭhānaṁ gamissati, pañca ca thālipākasatāni bhattābhihāro āharīyissati, hāniyeva, bhikkhave, devadattassa pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu, no vuddhi.
sn17.36:2.2.en: In the same way, as long as Prince Ajātasattu goes with five hundred carts in the morning and the evening to attend on Devadatta, presenting him with an offering of five hundred servings of food, Devadatta can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities.

an4.68:1.1.pli: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate acirapakkante devadatte.
an4.68:1.1.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain, not long after Devadatta had left.

an4.68:1.2.pli: Tatra kho bhagavā devadattaṁ ārabbha bhikkhū āmantesi:
an4.68:1.2.en: There the Buddha spoke to the mendicants about Devadatta:

an4.68:1.3.en: “Possessions, honor, and popularity came to Devadatta for his own ruin and downfall.

an4.68:5.2.pli: evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, attavadhāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādīti.
an4.68:5.2.en: In the same way, possessions, honor, and popularity came to Devadatta for his own ruin and downfall.

an8.8:7.5.pli: Ekamidaṁ, bhante uttara, samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate acirapakkante devadatte.
an8.8:7.5.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain, not long after Devadatta had left.

an8.8:7.6.pli: Tatra kho bhagavā devadattaṁ ārabbha bhikkhū āmantesi:
an8.8:7.6.en: There the Buddha spoke to the mendicants about Devadatta:

an8.8:8.5.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
an8.8:8.5.en: Overcome and overwhelmed by eight things that oppose the true teaching, Devadatta is going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.

an8.8:8.14.pli: pāpamittatāya, bhikkhave, abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
an8.8:8.14.en: bad friendship, Devadatta is going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.

an8.8:8.15.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
an8.8:8.15.en: Overcome and overwhelmed by these eight things that oppose the true teaching, Devadatta is going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.

an6.62:2.4.pli: “kiṁ nu kho, āvuso ānanda, sabbaṁ cetaso samannāharitvā nu kho devadatto bhagavatā byākato:
an6.62:2.4.en: “Reverend Ānanda, when the Buddha declared that Devadatta was

an6.62:4.3.pli: Nāhaṁ, ānanda, aññaṁ ekapuggalampi samanupassāmi, yo evaṁ mayā sabbaṁ cetaso samannāharitvā byākato, yathayidaṁ devadatto.
an6.62:4.3.en: I do not see a single other person concerning whom I have made a declaration about after giving such wholehearted deliberation as Devadatta.

an6.62:4.4.pli: Yāvakīvañcāhaṁ, ānanda, devadattassa vālaggakoṭinittudanamattampi sukkadhammaṁ addasaṁ;
an6.62:4.4.en: As long as I saw even a fraction of a hair’s tip of goodness in Devadatta

an6.62:4.7.pli: Yato ca kho ahaṁ, ānanda, devadattassa vālaggakoṭinittudanamattampi sukkadhammaṁ na addasaṁ;
an6.62:4.7.en: But when I saw that there was not even a fraction of a hair’s tip of goodness in Devadatta

an6.62:5.5.pli: Evamevaṁ kho ahaṁ, ānanda, yato devadattassa vālaggakoṭinittudanamattampi sukkadhammaṁ na addasaṁ;
an6.62:5.5.en: In the same way, when I saw that there was not even a fraction of a hair’s tip of goodness in Devadatta

sn17.35:1.1.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain, not long after Devadatta had left.

sn17.35:1.2.pli: Tatra kho bhagavā devadattaṁ ārabbha bhikkhū āmantesi:
sn17.35:1.2.en: There the Buddha spoke to the mendicants about Devadatta:

sn17.35:1.3.pli: “attavadhāya, bhikkhave, devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi.
sn17.35:1.3.en: “Possessions, honor, and popularity came to Devadatta for his own ruin and downfall.

sn17.35:5.2.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, attavadhāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi, parābhavāya devadattassa lābhasakkārasiloko udapādi.
sn17.35:5.2.en: In the same way, possessions, honor, and popularity came to Devadatta for his own ruin and downfall.

iti89:2.1.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
iti89:2.1.en: “Mendicants, overcome and overwhelmed by three things that oppose the true teaching, Devadatta is going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.

iti89:2.6.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho”ti.
iti89:2.6.en: Overcome and overwhelmed by these three things that oppose the true teaching, Devadatta is going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.11.pli: “Ayyo devadatto ayyo kokāliko ayyo kaṭamodakatissako ayyo khaṇḍadeviyā putto ayyo samuddadatto”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.11.en: “Venerable Devadatta, Venerable Kokālika, Venerable Kaṭamodakatissaka, Venerable Khaṇḍadeviyā-putta, and Venerable Samuddadatta.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.16.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.16.en: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.17.pli: “kathañhi nāma devadatto jānaṁ bhikkhuniparipācitaṁ piṇḍapātaṁ bhuñjissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.17.en: “How can Devadatta eat almsfood knowing that a nun had it prepared?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.18.pli: “saccaṁ kira tvaṁ, devadatta, jānaṁ bhikkhuniparipācitaṁ piṇḍapātaṁ bhuñjasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.18.en: “Is it true, Devadatta, that you did this?”

an9.26:1.4.en: “Reverends, Devadatta teaches the mendicants like this:

an9.26:2.2.pli: “na kho, āvuso candikāputta, devadatto bhikkhūnaṁ evaṁ dhammaṁ deseti:
an9.26:2.2.en: “Reverend Candikāputta, Devadatta does not teach the mendicants like that.

an9.26:4.6.pli: “na kho, āvuso candikāputta, devadatto bhikkhūnaṁ evaṁ dhammaṁ deseti:

26. The Simile of the Stone Pillar

mn58:3.13.en: ‘Then, sir, why exactly did you declare of Devadatta:

mn58:3.14.pli: “āpāyiko devadatto, nerayiko devadatto, kappaṭṭho devadatto, atekiccho devadatto”ti?
mn58:3.14.en: “Devadatta is going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable”?

mn58:3.15.pli: Tāya ca pana te vācāya devadatto kupito ahosi anattamano’ti.
mn58:3.15.en: Devadatta was angry and upset with what you said.’

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 58
With Prince Abhaya

an5.100:2.2.en: “Sir, this fixed desire arose in Devadatta:

an5.100:2.4.pli: Sahacittuppādā ca, bhante, devadatto tassā iddhiyā parihīno”ti.
an5.100:2.4.en: And as that thought arose, Devadatta lost that psychic power.”

an5.100:5.7.pli: Idāni so moghapuriso attanāva attānaṁ pātukarissati.
an5.100:5.7.en: Now that silly man Devadatta will expose himself by his own deeds.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 5
10. With Kakudha
100. With Kakudha

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena devadatto parihīnalābhasakkāro sapariso kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.2.en: At that time, because of decline in material support and loss of respect, Devadatta and his followers ate at invitations only after repeatedly asking.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma devadatto sapariso kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.8.en: “How can Devadatta and his followers eat at invitations after repeatedly asking?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.9.pli: “saccaṁ kira tvaṁ, devadatta, sapariso kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.9.en: “Is it true, Devadatta, that you do this?”

sn6.12:1.2.pli: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate acirapakkante devadatte.
sn6.12:1.2.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain, not long after Devadatta had left.

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 6
Chapter Two
12. About Devadatta

ud5.8:2.1.pli: Addasā kho devadatto āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ rājagahe piṇḍāya carantaṁ.
ud5.8:2.1.en: Devadatta saw him wandering for alms,

ud5.8:4.5.pli: Ajja, bhante, devadatto saṅghaṁ bhindissati, uposathañca karissati saṅghakammāni cā”ti.
ud5.8:4.5.en: “Today, sir, Devadatta will split the Saṅgha. He will perform the sabbath and legal proceedings of the Saṅgha.”

sn14.15:1.9.pli: devadattopi kho sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṁ bhagavato avidūre caṅkamati.

sn14.15:2.23.pli: Passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, devadattaṁ sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṁ caṅkamantan”ti?
sn14.15:2.23.en: Do you see Devadatta walking together with several mendicants?”

mn29:1.2.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain, not long after Devadatta had left.

mn29:1.3.en: There the Buddha spoke to the mendicants about Devadatta:

The Longer Simile of the Heartwood

sn17.31:1.3.pli: Lābhasakkārasilokena abhibhūto pariyādiṇṇacitto, bhikkhave, devadatto saṅghaṁ bhindi.
sn17.31:1.3.en: Devadatta split the Saṅgha because his mind was overcome and overwhelmed by possessions, honor, and popularity.

31. Schism

sn17.32:1.3.pli: Lābhasakkārasilokena abhibhūtassa pariyādiṇṇacittassa, bhikkhave, devadattassa kusalamūlaṁ samucchedamagamā.
sn17.32:1.3.en: Devadatta cut off his skillful root because his mind was overcome and overwhelmed by possessions, honor, and popularity.

32. Skillful Root

sn17.33:1.3.pli: Lābhasakkārasilokena abhibhūtassa pariyādiṇṇacittassa, bhikkhave, devadattassa kusalo dhammo samucchedamagamā.
sn17.33:1.3.en: Devadatta cut off his skillful quality because his mind was overcome and overwhelmed by possessions, honor, and popularity.

33. Skillful Quality

sn17.34:1.3.pli: Lābhasakkārasilokena abhibhūtassa pariyādiṇṇacittassa, bhikkhave, devadattassa sukko dhammo samucchedamagamā.
sn17.34:1.3.en: Devadatta cut off his bright quality because his mind was overcome and overwhelmed by possessions, honor, and popularity.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.4.pli: “na tāvāhaṁ, ayyā, sikkhamānaṁ vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti there bhikkhū uyyojetvā devadattaṁ kokālikaṁ kaṭamodakatissakaṁ khaṇḍadeviyā puttaṁ samuddadattaṁ sannipātetvā sikkhamānaṁ vuṭṭhāpesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.4.en: “Venerables, I won’t give the full admission to the trainee nun just yet.” She then gathered Devadatta, Kokālika, Kaṭamodakatissaka, Khaṇḍadeviyāputta, and Samuddadatta, and gave the full admission to that trainee nun.

pli-tv-kd2:16.8.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena devadatto sagahaṭṭhāya parisāya pātimokkhaṁ uddisati.
pli-tv-kd2:16.8.1.en: On one occasion Devadatta recited the Monastic Code in a gathering that included lay people.
